content.description:
Start on the southernmost face of the formation about eight feet left of Dr. Robert Titzer (5.7) and just right of a chimney.

Climb the left arÃªte of the south face of the formation using plates.
content.protection: Use an anchor rope to fashion an anchor on the summit horn.

climbs.name: Tattered
climbs.fa: Jonathan Clark, Al Hospers, Todd & Donette Swain

content.description: Start in a short chasm on the north side of the formation. Climb an overhanging, rotten crack (crux) then go up and left on a nice varnished face to the summit. The upper portion of this route is clearly visible as you approach the formation from Gripped Up The Hole.
content.protection: Carry a couple finger and hand sized pieces. Rappel with one rope.
content.location: Start in a short chasm on the north side of the formation. The chasm is about 50 feet left of the previous route (Tit for Tat). The upper portion of this route is clearly visible as you approach the formation from Gripped Up The Hole.

content.description: The route ascends the south face face 2 bolts and joins Dr. Robert Titzer at the last bolt.
content.protection: Three bolts and you can sling a horn on the left before the 3rd bolt if you wish.
content.location: Mel Gibson Spire of Tranquility, behind Turtle Rock in the Real Hidden Valley Area.

content.description: Start below a corner system on the east face of the easternmost boulder. This is about six feet to the right of Sugartits (5.9+). Stem up the corner and over the ceiling near the top of the crag to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: TR from anchors on the summit of the formation.
content.location: Start below a corner system on the east face of the easternmost boulder.

content.description: Climb the initial overhanging crack of Tattered, then step left and climb the steep, varnished arete to the summit.
content.protection: TR off the anchors on the summit of the formation.
content.location: This route is just left of Tattered on the north face of the formation.

climbs.name: The Gymbag
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tim Pinar, Gina Barerra, Rich Barerra

content.description: This is a short stemming and crack climb around the corner and right of Sugartits.  It has one bolt to protect face climbing into a left facing corner with a crack.
content.protection: One quick draw for the bolt, a few cams for the crack (one small, one med, one large), and 2 bolts for the anchor.
content.location: Mel Gibson Spire of Tranquillity is located south of Turtle Rock

content.description: This climb is on the south face of the Mel Gibson Spire of Tranquility.  It has 3 bolts and goes to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Three quick draws for three bolts, and you can sling a horn or two if you wish.  2 bolt anchor on top.
content.location: About 50 yards east of Gripped Up the Hole, behind Turtle Rock in the Real Hidden Valley Area.
